channel.title: Sig!
channel.description:
lol...well i can honestly say this is my 3rd or 4th sig ive ever made. All the others were just abstract brushes for a backround then my name without a render, so i kinda consider this my first "real" one. thanks to solemage for the renders :P
[img]http://img79.imageshack.us/img79/2646/pwnjsigmb9.png[/img]
i used two different tuts, one on making renders pop out, and one on this kind of background. I combined them both using my own render (well, off of a render pack) and my own background. 100% unique :D except the render is pretty familiar...

item.title: Sig!
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

lol, i’m so glad that ie adds a little something to images whenever it feels the need…very good job on the sig. gimme your bloody fonts!

item.title: Sig!
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Ahh, it must be. My dam FireFox is broken :o Sorry xD

As I said, very good work for your first few.

item.title: Sig!
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

hm? i did save it as a png. and what do you mean by blue surrounding it? you mean the transparency?

thanks for the compliment

oh yea i see what your saying. I think it might be because your running IE am i correct? because when i switched over to IE on this computer and my laptop, i get this wierd blue thing filling in where it should be transparent.

Read full topic

item.title: Sig!
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Save it as a .PNG, and you wont have the blue surrounding the sig. Very good work for your first few attempts.

Read full topic
